title: Election 2015: North West debate - BBC News
summary: voters put questions to a panel of candidates from the north west .
the debate was shown on wednesday at 22:50 on bbc one .

documents.title: good night
text: thanks for staying up and keeping me company tonight .
there will be further reaction on bbc north west tonight tomorrow , so please tune in .
author: Tom Airey
BBC News

documents.title: reaction : 'still do n't have a clue '
text: @ twitterid
still do n't have a clue on who to vote for # ge2015nw
@ twitterid ryan , the important thing is to vote .
that 's all .
we need apprentices trained up to do proper engineering work .
@ twitterid and i understand that .
but nhs cuts 0 hour contracts .
each party has different views but not all support .
@ twitterid as far as zero hours contacts , a foot in the door is better than a boot in it , up the arse .
@ twitterid yeah fair enough .
but if i were to be on a 0 hour contract .
i have bills to pay , 3 mouths to feed and to keep a roof over my

documents.title: sticking up for the old folk
text: socks chick
i hate the way old people are blamed for visits to a & e .
i saw stats that said most visits were from people between 30/45 # ge2015nw

documents.title: roger nailed it
text: mark whitehead from salford
great to have a regional debate , but it did end up stuck on the national themes more than i 'd have liked # ge2015nw # rogernailedit
@ twitterid you have a point but we are finding the national issues keep coming up whenever we ask the audience what 's important .
@ twitterid yep , it 's inevitable .
still , nice to hear northern voices at it !
@ twitterid and especially right a bough @ twitterid !

documents.title: your comments
text: thanks for all your reaction to tonight 's north west election debate which are continuing to come in on social media .
do n't forget to use # ge2015nw
author: Tom Airey
BBC News

documents.title: a 'poor ' campaign for most parties
text: julie tempest
did enjoy being part of @ twitterid # ge2015nw debate .
but for me showed how poor the overall # ge2015 campaign has been for most parties

documents.title: that 's all , folks
text: that concludes our live coverage of the north west debate .
thanks to all who have tuned in and got involved online using the hashtag # ge2015nw
with only a week to go until the general election , the countdown to the vote now really begins .
author: Election 2015

text: @ twitterid

ukip chap = blame labour .
healthcare is about people .
# ge2015nw
# ge2015nw local councils do not run long-term social care any more it 's all in the private sector

documents.title: reaction : nw independence ?
text: @ twitterid
@ twitterid
@ twitterid
# ge2015nw # scotland # independent # wales # independence why not # northwest # independence too ?
is bickley here to debate or just attack the labour party at every junction ?
# ge2015nw

documents.title: 'balance the books '
text: a woman at the front says : `` we are spending more now on debt repayment than on defence spending .
how are we going to start some far bigger issues ? ''
conservative ben wallace responds : `` until we balance the books , we ca n't pay the debt down .
we ca n't do it overnight . ''

documents.title: patch up the nhs
text: presenter roger johnson ask the green party 's elizabeth ward how her party will patch up the nhs .
she responds : `` we 're committed to £ 12bn extra spending on the nhs , but we believe you ca n't just throw money at the problem , you have to really look at the situation .
`` we 're careering towards a future where great numbers of our population will be over 65 , the government and the previous government have not thought that through . ''

documents.title: reaction : northern government ?
text: @ twitterid
@ twitterid
@ twitterid
why cant we have a northern government fed up run by south who only look after themselves # ge2015nw
# ge2015nw we would not have a health service without immigration
great to have a regional debate on tv , got to stay up late for it !
# ge2015nw

documents.title: 'protected the nhs '
text: conservative ben wallace said the nhs needs a `` sound economy to fund it '' .
he said : `` the coalition had to fix a broken economy when it came in in 2010 where we were borrowing £ 241,000 a minute more than we were raising in revenues .
`` despite this , we protected the nhs , we increased spending by £ 12.5bn '' .

documents.title: further pfi criticism
text: lib dem gordon birtwistle said : `` the local hospital in burnley was built for a cost on a pfi , the cost of the hospital was £ 130m .
by the time the trust has finished paying for it , it will cost £ 2bn .
`` that money could be used to finance health , finance social care , mental health care .
the vast amount of cash that is leaking from the nhs is to fund these hideous pfi schemes . ''

documents.title: 'back to the bare bones '
text: labour 's lucy powell says : `` we have too many older people turning up at a & e and taking up beds and doctors ' time , when they should be being better looked after at home or in the community .
`` one of the reasons for that is we have seen cutting back to the bare bones of social care which has meant people have had to go to hospital .
`` labour has long been campaigning for the integration of health and social care .
we need to ensure that the nhs has the money and the staff it needs . ''

documents.title: 'millstone round their necks '
text: speaking about the nhs , ukip 's john bickley says : `` the last labour government has made a lot of city bankers and fat cats very rich .
`` they let them do lots of pfi deals - which on one level means we have new hospitals , but on another the hospitals have a millstone round their necks .
they have a massive debt payments that they have to keep paying for 25 to 30 years . ''
he added labour used the nhs `` like a crutch '' and outsourced too much to the private sector .

documents.title: reaction : 'unemployment figures are n't representative '
text: @ twitterid
@ twitterid
@ twitterid
unemployment figures are n't representative of the real # ge2015nw
@ twitterid because they are a clear fiddle !
the awkward moment when ben wallace makes a comment about zero hours contract and elizabeth ward shoots him down `` i 'm on one ! ''
# ge2015nw
@ twitterid if wages go up , the cost of goods and services will do to , the cost always get pass on .
# ge2015nw

documents.title: does the nhs need a re-think ?
text: phil mcdermott , from edgworth , asks : `` even with the extra funding being promised by some of the parties , does n't the aging population mean that the nhs needs a fundamental re-think ? ''

documents.title: 'dickensian times '
text: a woman at the back says the panel are n't aware of how tough it is at the moment for working families .
she says : `` i do n't know what city you 're living in , but in the city i live in , the poverty - you might as well go back to dickensian times . ''

documents.title: arguments are 'farcical '
text: there 's applause from the audience after a lady sat at the front calls the panel 's arguing `` almost farcical '' as `` we will not have a majority government '' .
lib dem gordon birtwistle responds his party `` had to align themselves with the conservatives '' in 2010 .
he continued : `` the labour party wanted to bottle out - they had left the mess , they did n't want to know . ''

documents.title: 'flexibility to work elsewhere '
text: ukip 's john bickley accuses the labour party themselves of using zero-hour contracts .
lucy powell jumps in to flatly deny this .
mr bickley said : `` we say , if you are working on a zero-hours contract , the company can not bind you to them only , you would have the flexibility to work elsewhere . ''
the candidate says people who are told to work with only 12 hours ' notice `` should be paid '' if the work is then taken away at the last-minute .

documents.title: # ge2015nw reminder
text: quick reminder - get in touch with us by using the hashtag

documents.title: burnley apprentices
text: lib dem gordon birtwistle says over the 13 years of a labour government they `` virtually destroyed '' manufacturing .

he goes on : `` the problem is at the moment is we do n't have the skilled people to do the vacant jobs and that 's why the government brought in apprenticeships - another thing the labour party virtually got rid of .
`` there are over 4,000 apprentices in burnley learning real skills , jobs for the future that will be highly paid . ''

documents.title: zero-hours 'not fun '
text: green party candidate elizabeth ward , 22 , tells the audience she is currently on a zero-hour contract and describes them as `` not fun '' .
she says she is among 70,000 people in the north west on zero-hour contracts .
`` one week i 'm on 20 hours , then next week i 'm on 40 hours then the next week i 'm on 12 hours .
it 's impossible to plan your life , '' she said .
ms ward continued : `` [ the north west ] is not the economic heartland the tories will have you believe , we are missing a trick here with the green industries that need more investment . ''

documents.title: 'a labour party myth '
text: a lady in the audience says ben wallace should `` feel '' ashamed for the impact the government 's austerity measures have had on people looking for work in greater manchester .
mr wallace says a office for national statistics survey shows that zero-hours contracts are between 0.8 % and 1.2 % of the workforce .
he said it was a `` labour party myth '' that the jobs being created were zero-hour positions .

documents.title: 'constituents feeling worse off '
text: lucy powell says she is `` glad '' to see devolved powers for greater manchester and even praises george osborne for continuing the path `` started by labour '' .
she said : `` at the heart of this election is ed miliband 's promise that he wants the next generation to do better than the last .
let 's be honest , most young people at the moment do n't feel like that .
most of my constituents are not feeling the benefits of this recovery , they are feeling worse off . ''
she adds labour will reduce tuition fees , provide better access to apprenticeships and provide jobs other than zero-hour contracts .

documents.title: 'i would rather live here '
text: presenter roger johnson challenges conservative ben wallace to answer the question without saying 'northern powerhouse ' .
he said : `` the north is growing faster than the south , and that never happened under the 13 years of labour . ''
mr wallace continues : `` i would rather live here than anywhere down south - where everything is more expensive and the quality of life is far worse '' .
( a completely fictional alarm goes off when the candidate indeed mentions the northern powerhouse . )

documents.title: second question
text: tonight 's second question comes from esu hill , from sale , who asks : `` my daughter is studying for a phd at oxford .
what can the panel do to persuade her that her future lies in the north west ? ''

documents.title: heading for a tie ?
text: in a possible bid to remain completely impartial , the debate 's presenter roger johnson has the most multi-coloured tie in his collection .
channel 4 's jon snow would be proud of that one .

documents.title: greens and ukip clash
text: john bickley says we have `` a right to control our borders '' , while elizabeth ward says we were `` a country built on immigration '' .
ms ward said she came from a family who came to the uk `` not particularly skilled '' , but then built up their roles .

documents.title: reaction : election promises
text: @ twitterid
@ twitterid
@ twitterid
why are people getting sanctioned for having no job history if they do n't know how to use a computer # ge2015nw
roger johnson 's tie is out of control .
# ge2015nw

documents.title: 'short of skilled people '
text: gordon birtwistle of the liberal democrats said immigrants who were `` creating wealth and prosperity '' were `` more than welcome '' .
he said : `` the north west of england is a manufacturing area , and we are desperately short of skilled people . ''

documents.title: immigration 'works both ways '
text: elizabeth ward says the green party treated immigrants `` as people '' .
`` i think the term 'immigrant ' has become highly politicised .
the party recognises the economic importance of eu migrants to the uk .
`` we reject a complete open borders policy .
we want controlled migration , working with the eu , and we need to realise that it works both ways .
there are two million brits that live in the eu . ''

documents.title: 'hit our targets '
text: conservative ben wallace said while immigration for the north west was positive , uncontrolled immigration is `` not a good thing '' .
he said : `` in 2010 , 90 % of the new jobs were being taken by foreign nationals , while at the same time 1.4m british nationals were off work on benefits .
that 's wrong .
`` we have hit our targets and capped the numbers of non-eu citizens coming here . ''

documents.title: 'points-based system '
text: ukip 's john bickley says they were the only political party that was having an `` open debate '' about immigration .
he said : `` this is a sovereign country last time i looked , our dna is about controlling our country and parliament making our laws .
`` we have been saying we want an australian type , ethical , points-based immigration system . ''

documents.title: 'demonising immigrants '
text: presenter roger johnson puts it to lucy powell that she had advised labour candidates `` not to talk about immigration '' in the past , which she denies .
she said : `` we need a balanced debate as it is a very sensitive issue .
it 's not prejudice of people to worry about immigration , but equally we should n't be demonising immigrants and setting one side of society against another . ''
ms powell added the labour party are putting forward `` sensible controls '' on immigration .

documents.title: immigration question
text: tonight 's first question comes from garrick prayogg , from liverpool , who asks :
`` what part do immigrants play in the future of the north west , and why have the parties allowed the debate to become so toxic ? ''

documents.title: meet the panel
text: tonight 's panel is made up of ( from left to right ) :
lucy powell , labour and co-operative candidate for manchester central (
john bickley , ukip candidate for heywood and middleton (
ben wallace , conservative candidate for wyre and preston north (
elizabeth ward , green candidate for st helens north (
gordon birtwistle , lib dem candidate for burnley & padiham (

documents.title: the debate 's about to kick off
text: the mediacityuk studio used for the nw election debate is usually reserved for filming match of the day .
despite no sign of robbie savage this evening , things may still kick off .

documents.title: in the green room
text: after a quick bit of make-up and a microphone check , the panellists are ready to take their seats .
the biscuits are staying in the green room , which is bad news for the guests but excellent news for me .

documents.title: election news
text: you can keep up-to-date with all the latest news on the general election on the bbc 's
author: Election 2015

documents.title: warm-up act
text: as the panellists get miked up , bbc radio manchester 's allan beswick warms up the audience with a gentle opener of : `` what changes would you make to the bbc licence fee '' ?

documents.title: # ge2015nw
text: you can add your voice to the debate tonight by using the twitter hashtag
we 'll try to include as many comments as possible on our live page .

documents.title: north west 2015 election debate
text: welcome to the north west 2015 election debate , which will start on bbc one at 22:50 .
i 'll be writing updates during the debate and also featuring some of your reaction from social media .
tonight 's debate will cover to including immigration , devolution and the nhs .
author: Tom Airey
BBC News
